title: NPM Packages
description: The following are a few really awesome NPM packages I am using to create this!

value.title: material-ui
value.description: React UI framework

value.title: react
value.description: React is an open-source, front end, JavaScript library for building user interfaces or UI components.

value.title: react-colorful
value.description: react-colorful is a tiny color picker component for React and Preact apps.

value.title: react-ga
value.description: Library used to include Google Analytics tracking code in a website or app that uses React.

value.title: redux
value.description: Redux is an open-source JavaScript library for managing application state.

value.title: tinycolor
value.description: TinyColor is a small library for color manipulation and conversion.

value.title: craco
value.description: Create React App Configuration Override is an easy and comprehensible configuration layer for create-react-app.

value.title: create-react-app
value.description: Officially supported way to get started creating a single-page React application

value.title: postcss-purgecss
value.description: PurgeCSS analyzes your content and your css files. It removes unused selectors from your css, resulting in smaller css files.

value.title: eslint
value.description: ESLint is a static code analysis tool for identifying problematic patterns found in JavaScript code.

value.title: husky
value.description: Husky provides easy to use script running with git hooks.

value.title: lint-staged
value.description: Run linters against staged git files

value.title: prettier
value.description: An opinionated code formatter

value.title: redux-devtools-extension
value.description: Developer Tools to power-up Redux development workflow.

title: Color Tool
description: This was part of the original inspiration of this app. Allows for switching between different color representation formats, this lets you easily convert from one format to another. Also this tool generates various palettes based on your input color so you can find the perfect color you are looking for.

value.title: Lighter
value.description: Generates a palette that progressively gets lighter with each swatch.

value.title: Darker
value.description: Generates a palette that progressively gets darker with each swatch.

value.title: Tint
value.description: Generates a palette a palette of tints based on your color.

value.title: Shade
value.description: Generates a palette a palette of shades based on your color.

value.title: Saturated
value.description: Generates a palette that gets more saturated with each swatch.

value.title: Desaturated
value.description: Generates a palette that gets more desaturated with each swatch.

value.title: Analogous
value.description: Analogous color schemes use colors that are next to each other on the color wheel. They usually match well and create serene and comfortable designs.

value.title: Complementary
value.description: Colors that are opposite each other on the color wheel are considered to be complementary colors (example: red and green).

value.title: Split Complement
value.description: The split-complementary color scheme is a variation of the complementary color scheme. In addition to the base color, it uses the two colors adjacent to its complement.

value.title: Triadic
value.description: A triadic color scheme uses colors that are evenly spaced around the color wheel.

value.title: Tetradic
value.description: The rectangle or tetradic color scheme uses four colors arranged into two complementary pairs.

value.title: Monochromatic
value.description: Monochromatic schemes use different tones from the same angle on the color wheel (the same hue).

value.title: Hex
value.description: Example: #0FADED

value.title: Hex 8
value.description: Example: #0FADEDFF

value.title: RGB
value.description: Example: rgb(15, 173, 237)

value.title: RGBA
value.description: Example: rgba(15, 173, 237, 1)

value.title: HSL
value.description: Example: hsl(197, 88%, 49%)

value.title: HSLA
value.description: Example: hsla(197, 88%, 49%, 1)

title: Color Blender
description: A tool to take two colors then finding the resulting mix of the two.

title: Contrast Checker
description: A tool to compare the contrast ratio between two colors. Has a live demonstration of how the colors look in contrast with each other using some mock webpage components.
Also gives you a table of passing scores so you can see if your color choices pass AA or AAA criteria for WCAG.

title: Color Palette
description: A tool to add colors to a virtual palette, up to 8 swatches can be added to the page.
Each swatch provides custom controls to change the color using any of the 6 color formats. As well as easy to use copy and delete buttons.

title: Random Color
description: A tool to generate a random color. Allows for setting a hue and luminosity to generate a color within a defined set of parameters.
